title: Emotes

properties.name: description
properties.value: Emotes are a selection of movements that a player can perform. Some emotes are unlocked by default, to be unlocked through random events, quests, the Stronghold of Security, holiday events, or obtaining a skillcape. Emotes are currently the only way one can communicate as a muted player.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Emotes
This article is about is about the selection of performable emotes. For the emote clue scroll solutions, see emote clues.
The emotes interface.

Emotes are a selection of movements that a player can perform. Some emotes are unlocked by default, to be unlocked through random events, quests, the Stronghold of Security, holiday events, or obtaining a skillcape. Emotes are currently the only way one can communicate as a muted player.

Emotes are depicted as characters in the Emotes tab. In order of appearance; someone in full white armour with a white medium helmet, a man with the default player outfit and brown hair, a woman wearing what appears to be a woven top and skirt, a jester, Romeo, a goblin, a Mime, a woman wearing a bronze platebody and dragon plateskirt, a zombie, and a skillcape-wearer.

Emote icons that are bright in colour represent emotes that you have unlocked; either by default, or through the completion of a circumstance. On the other hand, dimmed out emote icons represent the emotes you have yet to unlock. Though the icon itself is obscured showing mostly the black frame, one can still hover over each locked emote to know its name. There are 51 Emote icons in total.

Contents

  • 1 Default
  • 2 Quests
  • 3 Random events
  • 4 Achievements
  • 5 Player security
  • 6 Holiday events
  • 7 Penguin emotes
  • 8 Others
  • 9 Changes

Default[edit | edit source]

A player performing the Dance emote.

Default emotes are emotes unlocked upon creating an account. Thus, all players readily start off with 22 emotes regardless of gameplay progress.

These 22 emotes comprise of simple animations mainly for communication in complement with the chat system, though they are also used in Treasure Trails as a part of completing a clue scroll. One may use emotes when muted in means of communicating with others.

Icon Name Icon Name Icon Name Icon Name
Yes No Bow
(enhanced) 		Angry
(enhanced)
Think Wave Shrug Cheer
Beckon
(enhanced) 		Laugh Jump for Joy Yawn
(enhanced)
Dance
(enhanced) 		Jig Spin Headbang
Cry Blow Kiss Panic Raspberry
Clap Salute

Quests[edit | edit source]

A player performing the Goblin Salute emote.

These emotes are related to certain quests. Quests emotes can be unlocked during a quest.

Icon Name Info
Goblin Bow These emotes are unlocked during The Lost Tribe quest.
Goblin Salute
Flex This emote is unlocked during Below Ice Mountain quest.

Random events[edit | edit source]

A player performing the Push up emote.

These emotes are related to random events. Players must be presented with the event itself and complete it to unlock the emotes.

When completing either the Drill Demon, Mime or Gravedigger random event, players can be rewarded the typical costume piece the usual random events offer, or unlock an emote.

Icon Name Info
Glass Box These emotes are unlocked from participating in the Mime random event.
Climb Rope
Lean
Glass Wall
Zombie Walk These emotes are unlocked from participating in the Gravedigger random event.
Zombie Dance
Sit up These emotes are unlocked from participating in the Drill Demon random event.
Push up
Star jump
Jog

Achievements[edit | edit source]

A player performing the achievement diary cape's Skill Cape emote.

These emotes are related to certain achievements in the game. Achievements emotes vary in requirements, conditions and restrictions of method to be unlocked.

The Skill Cape emote is unlocked by default, though is categorised as an achievements emote due to the restriction of skill mastery. Without an eligible cape, the message You need to be wearing a skillcape in order to perform that emote. will appear in the chatbox even though this does not necessarily work with only skillcapes.

Icon Name Info
Skill Cape To perform this emote you will need to be wearing one of the 26 Capes of Accomplishment, which can be bought from selected NPCs once achieving skill mastery (level 99). This includes the Quest point cape.
Air Guitar This emote is unlocked once all non-holiday music have been unlocked and a music cape is purchased.
Uri transform This emote is unlocked once the player completes 300 hard clue scrolls.
Explore This emote is unlocked once the player completes 600 beginner clue scrolls.

Player security[edit | edit source]

A player performing the Stamp emote.

These emotes are related to the Stronghold of Security. Player security emotes are unlocked level intervals of the dungeon from the central chest.

Icon Name Info
Idea This emote is unlocked from the Box of Health.
Stamp This emote is unlocked from the Cradle of Life.
Flap
(enhanced) 		This emote is unlocked from the Gift of Peace.
Slap Head This emote is unlocked from the Grain of Plenty.

Holiday events[edit | edit source]

These emotes are related to holiday events. Holiday events emotes are unlocked upon completion of a seasonal event of a particular year, and are unique to the events as they cannot be unlocked by any other means.

A player performing the crazy dance emote.

All previous holiday events emotes will be unlocked given that the player completed the event on that particular year.

Icon Name Info
Rabbit Hop Unlocked during the 2013 Easter event.
Available on all Easter events afterwards.
Scared Unlocked during the 2013 Halloween event.
Available on all Halloween events afterwards.
Zombie Hand Unlocked during the 2014 Halloween event.
Available on all Halloween events afterwards.
Hypermobile Drinker Unlocked during the 2015 Halloween event.
Available on all Halloween events afterwards.
Smooth dance Unlocked during the 2017 Birthday event.
Available on all birthday events afterwards.
Crazy dance

Penguin emotes[edit | edit source]

These emotes are related to the Cold War quest and the clockwork suit. Penguin emotes are unique in which they could only be played when the player takes form of a penguin in the clockwork suit.

Penguin emotes were first encountered during the Cold War quest in which a sequence was used to convince the penguin at Ardougne Zoo. After the quests, players may reaccess the emotes by wearing the suit via Larry as many times as pleased.

Icon Name Emote Icon Name Emote
Shiver Cheer
Spin Wave
Clap Preen
Bow Flap

Others[edit | edit source]

Emotes in this category are emotes that are unlocked via other means.

Icon Name Info
Premier Shield Unlocked by redeeming the code premierclub18 from Diango
Relic Unlock Unlocked by storing a tier 3 relic hunter outfit on the outfitstand of your POH Leaguehall.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
14 April 2021
(update)

You can now use the Twisted or Trailblazer Cane emotes directly from the emotes interface (as long as you have a set of tier 3 relic hunter on your Leaguehall's outfit stand in your Player Owned House).

23 November 2017

The Premier Club 2018 emote can be redeemed via Diango in Draynor using the code premierclub18.

Some emotes are unlocked by default, to be unlocked through [[random events]], [[quests]], the [[Stronghold of Security]], [[holiday events]], or obtaining a [[skillcape]]. Emotes are currently the only way one can communicate as a [[mute]]d player. Emotes are depicted as characters in the Emotes tab. In order of appearance; someone in full [[white armour]] with a [[white medium helmet]], a man with the default player outfit and brown hair, a woman wearing what appears to be a [[Woven top|woven top]] and [[Skirt (Keldagrim)|skirt]], a [[jester outfit|jester]], [[Romeo]], a [[goblin|goblin]], a [[Mime]], a woman wearing a [[bronze platebody]] and [[dragon plateskirt]], a [[Zombie (common)|zombie]], and a skillcape-wearer. Emote icons that are bright in colour represent emotes that you have unlocked; either by default, or through the completion of a circumstance. On the other hand, dimmed out emote icons represent the emotes you have yet to unlock. Though the icon itself is obscured showing mostly the black frame, one can still hover over each locked emote to know its name. There are 51 Emote icons in total. ==Default== [[File:Dance.gif|frame|A player performing the Dance emote.]] Default emotes are emotes unlocked upon creating an [[account]]. Thus, all players readily start off with 22 emotes regardless of gameplay progress.
